page.title: 09Bishops Wood- Background.
page.content: In 1972 the Central Electricity Generating Board offered the then Worcestershire Education Authority the opportunity of use by schools of the 17 hectares ( 41 acres ) of mixed woodland surrounding{Bishops Wood {sub_station}near Stourport_on_Severn. They undertook to provide a class room building to act as a base for work by schools and the L.E.A.agreed to provide the furnishing and material necessary for field work.It aimed to provide two main features (1) a nature trail for school parties in general and (2) the facilities by means of which groups of pupils could carry out projects of a more individual nature. It was also hoped to give an appreciation of more general aspects. To encourage the understanding of sub_stations and the care taken in siting and screening them.(M.Dickson)
